p: Morin (2-(2,4-dihydroxy-phenyl)-3,5,7-trihydroxy-chromen-4-one) ( Figure 2), a member of the flavonols, is characterized by a yellowish pigment isolated from Chinese herbs in the Moraceae family, and exhibits hepatoprotective, cardioprotective and neuroprotective effects through antioxidant and anti-inflammatory mechanisms [ 59]. Morin (50 mg/kg, p.o., rat) protected gastric mucosal against indomethacin-induced damage by downregulating MPO, NF-κB, TNF-α, inducible nitric oxide synthase (iNOS), ICAM-1, IL-6 and caspase-3, as well as, upregulating prostaglandin E 2 (PGE 2) and SOD [ 60].
